description: Also known as 游높 The Angel (Human).
name: Tarot Symbolic Creatures
behavior: Also known as 游높 The Angel (Human).

christian.overview: The Angel/Man in Tarot tradition represents Matthew's Gospel and Christ's incarnation, deriving directly from biblical cherubim imagery.

biblicalParallels.description: The human face of the living creatures represents divine reason and humanity.
Matthew's Gospel opens with Christ's human genealogy, emphasizing incarnation.
"The Word became flesh" - the mystery of God taking human form.

evangelistConnection.matthew: The human/angel represents Matthew's Gospel, which opens with Christ's human ancestry and emphasizes his teaching as a new Moses.
evangelistConnection.incarnation: The human face represents Christ's taking of human nature - God becoming man.

tarotContext.kerubim: The angel/man as one of the Four Kerubim represents Matthew's Gospel and the air element (rational communication).
tarotContext.majorArcana: Angels appear throughout the Major Arcana (Lovers, Temperance, Judgment) representing divine guidance and spiritual transformation.

christian.typologicalReading: The human face among the living creatures prefigures the Incarnation - God taking human form to dwell among us.
scholarlyReferences: Place, Robert M. The Tarot: History, Symbolism, and Divination. Tarcher, 2005.
Decker, Ronald et al. A Wicked Pack of Cards. St. Martin's Press, 1996.
